questions.question: What type of immunity is provided by a vaccine?
Which of the following diseases is commonly treated with monoclonal antibodies?
Which immunotherapy is most commonly used for allergies?
What is the major benefit of active immunotherapy over passive immunotherapy?
options: It is effective against all diseases
It does not involve the immune system

questions.question: What is a major risk of passive immunotherapy?
What kind of immunity does a newborn receive from breast milk?
Which of the following therapies is NOT considered an immunotherapy?
What is the primary function of immune checkpoint inhibitors?
options: To block immune suppression by tumors
To eliminate all white blood cells
questions.answer: To block immune suppression by tumors

questions.question: Which of the following best defines active immunotherapy?
options: The body produces its own immune response
questions.answer: The body produces its own immune response

questions.question: What is the primary mechanism of action of passive immunotherapy?
options: Stimulating the immune system to produce antibodies
Directly providing antibodies or immune cells
Enhancing the immune system's ability to recognize pathogens
Boosting the production of immune cells
questions.answer: Directly providing antibodies or immune cells
